    • autocompleteIngredientSearchCall

      public okhttp3.Call autocompleteIngredientSearchCall(String query, Integer number, Boolean metaInformation, String intolerances, String language, ApiCallback _callback) throws ApiException
      Build call for autocompleteIngredientSearch
      Parameters:
      query - The (natural language) search query. (optional)
      number - The maximum number of items to return (between 1 and 100). Defaults to 10. (optional, default to 10)
      metaInformation - Whether to return more meta information about the ingredients. (optional)
      intolerances - A comma-separated list of intolerances. All recipes returned must not contain ingredients that are not suitable for people with the intolerances entered. See a full list of supported intolerances. (optional)
      language - The language of the input. Either 'en' or 'de'. (optional)
      _callback - Callback for upload/download progress
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object
      See Also:
      • Autocomplete Ingredient Search Documentation
      Http Response Details:
      Status Code Description Response Headers
      200 Success -
      401 Unauthorized -
      403 Forbidden -
      404 Not Found -
      Read entire docs

      Autocomplete Ingredient Search Autocomplete the entry of an ingredient.

      intolerances - A comma-separated list of intolerances. All recipes returned must not contain ingredients that are not suitable for people with the intolerances entered. See a full list of supported intolerances. (optional)
      language - The language of the input. Either 'en' or 'de'. (optional)
      Returns:

    • computeIngredientAmount

      public ComputeIngredientAmount200Response computeIngredientAmount(BigDecimal id, String nutrient, BigDecimal target, String unit) throws ApiException
      Compute Ingredient Amount Compute the amount you need of a certain ingredient for a certain nutritional goal. For example, how much pineapple do you have to eat to get 10 grams of protein?
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the ingredient you want the amount for. (required)
      nutrient - The target nutrient. See a list of supported nutrients. (required)
      target - The target number of the given nutrient. (required)
      unit - The target unit. (optional)
      Returns:
      ComputeIngredientAmount200Response
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to call the API, e.g. server error or cannot deserialize the response body

    • ingredientSearchCall

      public okhttp3.Call ingredientSearchCall(String query, Boolean addChildren, BigDecimal minProteinPercent, BigDecimal maxProteinPercent, BigDecimal minFatPercent, BigDecimal maxFatPercent, BigDecimal minCarbsPercent, BigDecimal maxCarbsPercent, Boolean metaInformation, String intolerances, String sort, String sortDirection, Integer offset, Integer number, String language, ApiCallback _callback) throws ApiException
      Build call for ingredientSearch
      Parameters:
      query - The (natural language) search query. (optional)
      addChildren - Whether to add children of found foods. (optional)
      minProteinPercent - The minimum percentage of protein the food must have (between 0 and 100). (optional)
      maxProteinPercent - The maximum percentage of protein the food can have (between 0 and 100). (optional)
      minFatPercent - The minimum percentage of fat the food must have (between 0 and 100). (optional)
      maxFatPercent - The maximum percentage of fat the food can have (between 0 and 100). (optional)
      minCarbsPercent - The minimum percentage of carbs the food must have (between 0 and 100). (optional)
      maxCarbsPercent - The maximum percentage of carbs the food can have (between 0 and 100). (optional)
      metaInformation - Whether to return more meta information about the ingredients. (optional)
      intolerances - A comma-separated list of intolerances. All recipes returned must not contain ingredients that are not suitable for people with the intolerances entered. See a full list of supported intolerances. (optional)
      sort - The strategy to sort recipes by. See a full list of supported sorting options. (optional)
      sortDirection - The direction in which to sort. Must be either 'asc' (ascending) or 'desc' (descending). (optional)
      offset - The number of results to skip (between 0 and 900). (optional)
      number - The maximum number of items to return (between 1 and 100). Defaults to 10. (optional, default to 10)
      language - The language of the input. Either 'en' or 'de'. (optional)
      _callback - Callback for upload/download progress
      Returns:
      Call to execute
      Throws:
      ApiException - If fail to serialize the request body object
      See Also:
      • Ingredient Search Documentation
      Http Response Details:
      Status Code Description Response Headers
      200 Success -
      401 Unauthorized -
      403 Forbidden -
      404 Not Found -
